intro: Batidaea strigosa subsp. sandbergii, commonly known as the sandberg's batidaea, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to specific regions in North America, particularly in the central and western United States. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
